0.user_question: Tom's ship can travel at 10 miles per hour.  He is sailing from 1 to 4 PM.  He then travels back at a rate of 6 mph.  How long does it take him to get back?

ost_step.1: Tom sails for hours from 1 to 4 PM. This means he travels at 10 mph for 3 hours (since 4 PM minus 1 PM equals 3 hours). So, Tom covers a distance of 10 x 3 = 30 miles during this time.
ost_step.2: Tom then sails back at 6 mph. We need to find out how long it takes him to cover the same 30-mile distance at this new speed. To do so, we divide the distance by his new speed: 30 miles / 6 miles/hour = 5 hours.
ost_step.3: The answer is: Tom takes 5 hours to return to his original location.
